Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class ConcreteModel

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.ConcreteModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Model, ObservableModel
public class ConcreteModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObservableModel, Model
The concrete model used through interfaces as the interchange waypoint from the model classes to the virtual view, the controller and the match classes

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ConcreteModel​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> players, boolean isHardCore)
    Initializes the model and creates the setup manager, the internal model nad the turn logic components.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addPacketCardsFromServerObserver​(Observer<PacketCardsFromServer> observer)
    Used to add the observer
    void addPacketDoActionObserver​(Observer<PacketDoAction> observer)
    Used to add the observer
    void addPacketPossibleBuildsObserver​(Observer<PacketPossibleBuilds> observer)
    Used to add the observer
    void addPacketPossibleMovesObserver​(Observer<PacketPossibleMoves> observer)
    Used to add the observer
    void addPacketSetupObserver​(Observer<PacketSetup> observer)
    Used to add the observer
    void addPacketUpdateBoardObserver​(Observer<PacketUpdateBoard> observer)
    Used to add the observer
    void getPossibleBuilds​(java.lang.String senderID, PacketBuild packetBuild)
    This method is used for the normal game mode, a client always asks for the possible builds to make the player choose from them only.
    void getPossibleMoves​(java.lang.String senderID, PacketMove packetMove)
    This method is used for the normal game mode, a client always asks for the possible moves to make the player choose from them only.
    void makeBuild​(java.lang.String senderID, PacketBuild packetBuild)
    Used by a client to propose a build action
    void makeMove​(java.lang.String senderID, PacketMove packetMove)
    Used by a client to propose a move action
    void setGameFinishedHandler​(Observer<java.lang.String> gameFinishedHandler)
    Used to add the handler for the game end event
    void setSelectedCards​(java.lang.String senderID, java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectedCards)
    This function is used when a client provides the server with some chosen cards, it checks that the server is indeed waiting for that choice and eventually saves the chosen cards and proceeds to ask the cards to the next player or ends the setup and asks the challenger to choose the starting player
    void setStartPlayer​(java.lang.String senderID, java.lang.String startPlayer)
    This function is supposed to be called when the challenger provides the choice regarding the starting player, it checks the choice and eventually asks the chosen starting player to place his workers
    void setWorkersPositions​(java.lang.String senderID, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.awt.Point> workersPositions)
    This function is supposed to be called when a player provides the chosen workers positions, it checks the choice and places the workers on the board, afterwards either asks the next player to place his workers and sends info of current workers' placements, or, if the setup is completed sets the relative phase and ends
    void start()
    Used by the match class to start a game

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove​(java.lang.String senderID, PacketMove packetMove) throws InvalidPacketException
      Description copied from interface: Model
      Used by a client to propose a move action
      Specified by:
      makeMove in interface Model
      Parameters:
      senderID - the requesting client
      packetMove - the proposed move
      Throws:
      InvalidPacketException - thrown if the proposing client is the one I am waiting, but the move is invalid or against the rules

    • getPossibleMoves

      public void getPossibleMoves​(java.lang.String senderID, PacketMove packetMove)
      Description copied from interface: Model
      This method is used for the normal game mode, a client always asks for the possible moves to make the player choose from them only. If the request is correct and valid the server answers with the requested possible moves
      Specified by:
      getPossibleMoves in interface Model
      Parameters:
      senderID - the asking client
      packetMove - the context of the request

    • getPossibleBuilds

    • setSelectedCards

      public void setSelectedCards​(java.lang.String senderID, java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectedCards) throws InvalidPacketException
      Description copied from interface: Model
      This function is used when a client provides the server with some chosen cards, it checks that the server is indeed waiting for that choice and eventually saves the chosen cards and proceeds to ask the cards to the next player or ends the setup and asks the challenger to choose the starting player
      Specified by:
      setSelectedCards in interface Model
      Parameters:
      senderID - the client providing the cards
      selectedCards - the chosen cards
      Throws:
      InvalidPacketException - if the sender is who I am waiting for, but makes some mistakes in the choice, I notify him by throwing this exception

    • setStartPlayer

      public void setStartPlayer​(java.lang.String senderID, java.lang.String startPlayer) throws InvalidPacketException
      Description copied from interface: Model
      This function is supposed to be called when the challenger provides the choice regarding the starting player, it checks the choice and eventually asks the chosen starting player to place his workers
      Specified by:
      setStartPlayer in interface Model
      Parameters:
      senderID - the client providing the choice
      startPlayer - the chosen starting player nickname
      Throws:
      InvalidPacketException - if the sender is who I am waiting for, but makes some mistakes in the choice, I notify him by throwing this exception

    • setWorkersPositions

      public void setWorkersPositions​(java.lang.String senderID, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.awt.Point> workersPositions) throws InvalidPacketException
      Description copied from interface: Model
      This function is supposed to be called when a player provides the chosen workers positions, it checks the choice and places the workers on the board, afterwards either asks the next player to place his workers and sends info of current workers' placements, or, if the setup is completed sets the relative phase and ends
      Specified by:
      setWorkersPositions in interface Model
      Parameters:
      senderID - the client providing the choice
      workersPositions - the proposed workers positions
      Throws:
      InvalidPacketException - if the sender is who I am waiting for, but makes some mistakes in the choice, I notify him by throwing this exception
